'Stage' is a live album released by the American hard rock band Great White in
1995. It was put together by Alan Niven, Great White's former manager, as a
contractual release for Zoo Entertainment.  The first six tracks of
the CD come from a 1994 House of Blues benefit concert (Stage One) and the other
songs from a 1993 Anaheim show (Stage Two), several tracks of which were
previously featured as a bonus on the studio album [[Sail Away (Great White
album)|Sail Away]]. The initial Japanese pressing was a two-disc set, and
featured one bonus track for each show.

The songs of this album, with the exception of "Maybe Someday" and "Congo
Square", were re-issued in 2004 by BMG Special Products, with the title
'Extended Versions'.
